Despite the use of various medications, the consensus of Chinese experts is that neuraminidase inhibitors (oseltamivir, peramivir, zanamivir, etc) and ganciclovir are not generally recommended. Routine prophylactic antibiotics, especially combined wide-spectrum antibiotics, are also not typically recommended.
33 However, because of the widespread use of the medications, as indicated in the previous paragraph, ongoing trials are being conducted to clarify which medications may or may not be helpful in treating COVID-19.
